etymology.description: ⿰革(革) (gé, "leather") + 勹(勹) (bāo, "wrap") + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") = earlier form of 鞠(鞠) (jū, "brew") -> derived from 麴(麴) (qū, "starter")
etymology.interpretation: The character 匊(jū, "rice in a house") is a phono-semantic compound clipped from 鞠(鞠), where the semantic 米(米) conveys the idea of rice, and phonetic components relate it to brewing and fermentation.

examples.chinese: 老祖先把米存於匊(老祖先把米存於匊)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo zǔxiān bǎ mǐ cún yú jū.
examples.english: The ancestors stored rice in the vessel.

examples.chinese: 丰收时节人们将新米安放于匊(豐收時節人們將新米安放於匊)，象征着家宅兴旺(象徵著家宅興旺)。
examples.pinyin: Fēngshōu shíjié rénmen jiāng xīnmǐ ānfàng yú jū, xiàngzhēng zhe jiāzhái xīngwàng.
examples.english: During the harvest season, people placed the new rice in the vessel, symbolizing the prosperity of the household.
